Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful stay! It is a great location!”
Reviews.Author: floydfloydfloyd
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room we had was small but perfect. There can be a lot of steps depending on what floor you are on but this was not a problem for us. The in-room wifi was fast and access was easy. You will be a five minute walk from the Blue Mosque. You can walk to the Grand Bazaar. Be sure to stop by the Hippodrome Restaurant after a long day of sightseeing. It is a five minute walk from the hotel and a great place to relax and grab a bite to eat. We definitely recommend staying at the Hotel Sphendon!

Reviews.Title: “As good as advertised...”
Reviews.Author: keiraned
Reviews.Content: Everything was great. Breakfast buffet could use more variety but the food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: pabel1
Reviews.Content: This spot was recommended to me by my Rick Steves Travel Guide and I was very happy I took the suggestion. This little boutique hotel is fantastic, clean, well run, quiet, and very well positioned in the old part of the city on a small winding neighborhood street. It is about a 6-7 min. walk up the hill to the Blue Mosque & Aya Sophia & a tram stop. There are lots of good restaurants very close. The staff was very polite, cordial and helpful. They arranged reasonably priced transportation from from the airport for me. The room was always well kept, clean and comfortable. Wi-Fi worked perfectly. All in all this is a GREAT spot for me to say!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, clean, friendly...”
Reviews.Author: iosebah
Reviews.Content: For us was a perfect location, you can go everywhere walking, the rooms were clean and quiet. The staff is very friendly and they can recommend you where to go and visit.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sphendon Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Lorraine L
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a fabulous trip to Istanbul, stayed at the Hotel Sphendon, which was absolutely charming!! It is spotlessly clean and the staff are incredibly professional, polite and very helpful! It is in a great position for easy access to the Blue Mosque etc. It is also near a delightful bazaar! The roof top area has fabulous views of The Blue Mosque and the Sea.....wonderful!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best budget hotel I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: twoweeksayear
Reviews.Content: This is the best budget hotel I've ever stayed in in Europe. The room was cute and clean, and the hotel was near everything. It was an easy 10-minute walk from the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia and about two blocks from a number of restaurants. I also really liked the rooftop terrace with a view of the sea, and there was a good spread at breakfast and nice little outdoor grotto in which to eat it. I also liked that there was a safe in the room. Now, obviously, this is a budget hotel, so don't expect a Marriott or Hyatt or Ritz. The rooms, as in most budget hotels, are small, but they're nice, and the bathroom was clean, cute and totally functional. It was an EXCELLENT value for the money, and I honestly can't think of one complaint. It exceeded my expectations for a budget hotel, and I would definitely stay here again. One note, though, I would definitely recommend taking a cab from the airport as opposed to public transportation, but I think that applies to almost any hotel in this area, as the streets can be a bit confusing. My husband and I usually try to take public transportation to save money, but we took cabs to and from Sphendon and considered it the best money ($25/$30 each way) we spent.

Reviews.Title: “ENDED UP HERE BY DEFAULT!”
Reviews.Author: fatih2011
Reviews.Content: I was given the option to stay here by Al Mina hotel. Check that review. Tiny, clean, attentive staff, QUIET rooms except for guests slamming doors! Beakfast appetizing, filling, different dishes, attentive staff. I might come again here as Levent at reception made a genuine effort to make me feel comfortable. He gave me an extra night at EUR 24 less. Encouraging gesture! He called my airport taxi before I even asked him and the chamber maid was just all smiles....She made a smiley face on my bed with small matchboxes after cleaning the room!That won me over! These guys really try!

Reviews.Title: “Nice,silent and clean:very relaxing staying”
Reviews.Author: juras77
Reviews.Content: The hotel is behind the Blue Mosquee.It is very silent and eden the muezzin is not so loud. The breakfast is excellent:rich and in the garden is perfect. The guys of the staff are very nice. The double room we had is not big but it has everything,also the security box. The hotel is in Sultanhamet not far from the tram T1

Reviews.Title: “A very good starting point to get to know Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Macc S
Reviews.Content: The service is very good (warm) and helpfulness of the staff is great. The location is great (close to everything that is historically relevant and the means of transport that serves as a link to the rest). The rooms are small (who wants to go to Istanbul to stay in the room?) but quite functional (toilet, air conditioning working very well, safes, refrigerators, etc.). It is very quiet. The breakfast is simple but good ( with a very good selection of cheeses) and you can start the day with vigor. Room cleanliness. The bathroom of the room is clean, and well, daily, the rest of the room is not done so efficiently. It's ok, but i think that itÂ´s one thing to improve. Sometimes, some inner noise. The Hotel is an old property which, although well restored, does not prevent passage of some noise when guests enter and leave the room and as there are people who do not know the rules of coexistence in society, from time to time there may be some discomfort, but overall it's very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Charming small hotel in a quiet and convenient location, very good value”
Reviews.Author: BAnder1708
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Sphendon for four nights during our visit to Istanbul last week and we were very pleased with it. Hotel Sphendon has a quiet location on a small street that is perhaps a five minute walk to the Blue Mosque and Hippodrome in the Old City and a ten minute walk to Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Museum, and the tram. Our en suite room, while on the small side, had a comfortable bed, good air conditioning with in room control, and excellent wifi access which was included in the room rate. We had a room in the back overlooking the pleasant garden seating area which was nice. The staff at this family run hotel was very friendly and helpful during our stay. Breakfasts were also very good here. Finally, there is a nice rooftop seating area overlooking the Sea of Marmara. We would certainly recommend Hotel Sphendon to others visiting Istanbul--it offers excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for the price”
Reviews.Author: Beth10023
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sphendon is a small, charming hotel in the back streets near Sultanhamet, Istanbul. Here are the negatives: the decor is a little overly flowery, the hotel is a little hard to find, and the breakfast could offer more fresh fruit. But the positives far outweigh those details: the amenities of a more expensive hotel (TV, refrigerator, multiple outlets, etc), lovely garden for a very good breakfast (with a ton of variety of cheeses, sweets, breads, vegetables and a few fruit options - just fewer fruits than other hotels), helpful staff, much quieter at night than hotels on the main streets, bigger room than we got at other places for the same price, etc. No elevator but the staff carried our suitcases up and down the stairs for us at the beginning and end of our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Lovelly Hotel with very helfull people”
Reviews.Author: moonwiccan
Reviews.Content: Very helpfull people at Sphendon Hotel, everyone help me with directions, hints and in every question I had. Nice place in a quiet and central area, just 2 minutes walk from Blue Mosque. Room was perfect for one person, very clean and pleasant, my room was facing the garden and it was very quiet and fresh. Air condioner worked very well and so did the wireless internet. Breakfast was tradicional turkish, always fresh fruit and salad and always something different for you to taste. There are cats all around Istanbul even at the hotel, but they are sweet and good company in the garden.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Thinkingmagpie
Reviews.Content: What a charming hotel! We chose this hotel based on the Trip Advisor reviews and we were quite happy with them. The hotel was really nicely decorated, very clean and the staff was very friendly. Itâ€™s a restored old house, so the room was a bit small, but that was what we expected anyway. The room had a facility we really appreciatedâ€¦a kettle & a selection of tea/coffee. (And I fell in love with the lamp in the roomâ€¦) We wished there were more fruits for breakfast since my husbandâ€™s diet was somewhat restricted (no salty food, no dairy & no preserved meat â€“ which left him with only toast & jam). But if you are not picky, thereâ€™s plenty to eat. I enjoyed cheese, pickles and pastries. We were given the room just above the reception facing the street, so the brief but loud noises from outside (carts going up and down the cobbled street, shout from the vegetable seller, truck loaded with gas bottles, etc.) was quit overwhelming from time to time. If you are out all day visiting places, these daytime noises wouldnâ€™t be a problem for you. We just like to break the day in half and like to have a nap in the afternoon, soâ€¦ If you are like us who enjoy your little afternoon sleep, we definitely recommend booking a room facing the courtyard. The staircase was a bit noisy as well. Again, this is a restored old house, so itâ€™s understandable. The hotel is located in the residential area off the main street, only a short walk to the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and the busy area of Sultanahmet. The streets are quite dark in the night, but you wouldnâ€™t feel threatened. We felt absolutely safe walking around the surrounding streets after dark. By the way, the hotel has very efficient heating system. Even if itâ€™s freezing outside, you wouldnâ€™t feel cold even a bit!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Rachida027
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel,very homy. The staff is warm,helpful and friendly. The location is great juste behind the blue mosque ,near all monuments of old Istanbul. very quiet neighborhood and the breakfast varied and plentiful. amazing view on marmara sea and the blue mosque from the terrace I had a wonderful time, I would gladly go back. Thanks a lot to the staff and specially Badija. Congratulation to owners Rachida Morocco

Reviews.Title: “Better than the photos!!!”
Reviews.Author: clarence2005
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel purely on trip advisor reviews and we were impressed that it lived up to all expectations. The hotel is very clean has lovely bathrooms and has been tastefully decorated. The photos on trip advisor make it look a little fussy but that is not the case at all. It is close to all the major attractions and the staff are very helpfull. The breakfast buffet is one of the best I have experienced!! Some noise does travel from the stairwell but not overly bothersome.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant small hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: cairowendy
Reviews.Content: I had a lovely 3 night stay at the hotel, was very impressed and it certainly was a pleasure to return there after a day out sightseeing. The staff were very polite and always ready to help. My room was over the garden and it was so quiet, which is amazing con sidering that it is only a few minutes away from SultanAhmet mosque. Enjoyed sitting on the terrace and watching the ships and lots of birds :) Would for sure stay there on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Charming B&B like hotel for a great value”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkCityNewYorker
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay as a solo traveler at the Sphendon in May. The staff is friendly and very professional and helpful, there is a great buffet breakfast spread, pretty backyard garden for breakfast, and the rooms, while on the small side are charming and clean and are decoated in a way that feel like staying at a charming B&B, it's also a great value for the quality of the room and breakfast. The hotel is not located right smack in the center of the Old Quarter but it's still close to all the major attractions and I felt safe walking to and from the hotel at night, it also feels less touristy. Like other hotels in the Old Quarter, you will hear the morning call to prayer very early in the morning -- although it woke me up, I valued experiencing this cultural aspect of traveling to an Islamic country that I had not exposed to before.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot near everything with a quiet back yard.”
Reviews.Author: SeattleViajero
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here three nights in early July. It was everything we had expected. Yes, rooms and bathrooms are quite small but that was okay with us. The highlight is the back garden. If you can, request a room facing the garden. You have a lovely ancient wall and beautiful small garden to look at and NO ONE looking at you! This is surprising and nice considering how close everything is. The one downfall is the loud staircase. It echoes everything even when people are quiet. They might benefit from carpet in the hall. The hotel was only full our last night so it did not bother us too much. The staff is wonderful. When a surprising rain storm came through (really-a downpour in July!) they loaned us an umbrella for the day.

Reviews.Title: “congratulations to the owners of this fine, family-run hotel”
Reviews.Author: UF_prof
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent four days here on our first trip to Istanbul. The staff could not be more helpful. The hotel is well located, if you don't mind walking a short distance up a hill to main attractions such as the Blue Mosque and Topkapi. The hotel is not fancy, but is good value for money, with fine AC, bathroom facilities, internet connection, and breakfast. We enjoyed Istanbul, and when we return we will try to stay again at Hotel Sphendon.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent base for exploring the city!!”
Reviews.Author: DavidLivingstone
Reviews.Content: What a find!! This delightful small hotel is right in the middle of most of the things we came to Istanbul to experience . . . the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, spectacular views from the hotel terrace of the city and the Sea of Marmaras, all the mystique, charm and beauty of the Sultanahmet. The owners have, wisely, kept the exterior of the hotel as it must have looked a hundred years ago, but it is brand new on the inside. Our room was very well decorated, comfortable, and up-to-date, but with the flavor of Istanbul. The hotel is family owned and operated and their attention to every detail reflects their pride of ownership. Even the complimentary breakfast was good. The Sphendon is an excellent base for exploring the city. We highly recommend this hotel, and its staff . . . and their rates make it a bargain as well!

Reviews.Title: “Would not hesitate to recommend this brilliant hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AuntiePizza
Reviews.Content: Great location, wonderful staff, excellent breakfast, clean & warm rooms, comfy beds. In all of my travels this is the best hotel I have ever had the pleasure to stay in, the extremely reasonable room rates were a bonus. Take some time out on the roof terrace and just enjoy! I would go back in an instant, I hope you book and support a genuine family business and love it as much as we all did (8 females).

Reviews.Title: “Superb - You will not find better”
Reviews.Author: tosssademar
Reviews.Content: This hotel was without doubt one of the best have stayed in. Breakfast is a delight - so much choice with very attentive staff. Rooms are very comfortable and clean. Roof terrace was fabulous - wonderful views and very peaceful. Staff were fantastic - friendly and full of useful info about the best way to go about exploring wonderful Istanbul. Location perfect for sights in the old town. Istanbul is amazing. Overall an extremely enjoyable hol. Would recommend Istanbul and a stay at this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: jane47Leicester
Reviews.Content: A fabulous hotel, and the staff are really helpful and friendly. It may be small but its comfortable and in a fantastic location. The roof terrace is a great place with sea and mosque views. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone - you'll love it!

Reviews.Title: “super hotel”
Reviews.Author: maradem
Reviews.Content: Great atmosphere, clean and cosy rooms, nice helpfull staff, good breakfast. All positive about this hotel. Can recomment to evryone who likes small hotel in good area.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: christina31
Reviews.Content: I liked this boutique hotel very much. The rooms are beautifully decorated with a romantic style, quite spacious and very clean. The view from the terrace, where you can rest, have your breakfast or a coffee is very nice. The little garden also at the back of the hotel is charm and well kept. The breakfast has a good variety for all tastes. The stuff is very nice and extremely helpful and I'd like to thank them all. The hotel is in walking distance from all the best sights in Istanbul and the historic centre. If I visit Istanbul again i will sure stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, beautiful place in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: RaviAnywhere
Reviews.Content: Sphendon was only a few weeks old when we stayed, but everything was running perfectly. Staff were extremely helpful and friendly, and Bahadir and the breakfast attendants were especially gracious, including mailing our post for us when we were departing. The owner Erdal was also quite nice. Breakfast and airport transfers are included, which is nice, and the breakfast is very delicious although after 5 days some change and variety would have been welcome. The Hotel is an easy walk to the Blue Mosque and elsewhere, and the staff provided advice on directions as well as use of their computers and internet connection, just to be helpful. Overall, a beautiful hotel with excellent and friendly staff.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Sphendon
HotelInfo.Address: Eminonu, Akbiyik Degirmeni Sk, 50, Istanbul 34122, Turkey
